content: anna m pattern and photos tiina kuu tech editing helena kahan the anna m sock design was greatly inspired by anna mäkilä s raitaa ja ruusua sock design the appeal of the design is the striped tomato heel with small gussets which is my modification of the sweet tomato heel first introduced by cat bordhi yarn and yardage main colour mc adelia fibers merino sock 75 % merino 25 % nylon 425 m / 100 g 40- 50 grams of teal riikinkukko colourway contrast colour 1 cc1 borgo de pazzi bice 75 % wool 25 % nylon 420 m / 100 g 30-40 grams of off-white size contrast colour 2 cc2 lucky omen yarns merino sock 75 % merino 25 % nylon there are instructions for sizes small 64 sts 425 m / 100 g 10-15 grams of red red wine medium/large 72 sts and extra-large 80 sts colourway which are referred to in the instructions as s m/l xl if only one stitch count is given it applies to all sizes with the given gauge sizes gauge s m/l xl fit foot circumference of approximately 18 5 21 23 5 cm / 7⅜ 8¼ 9 36 sts and 44 row in stockinette stitch with ¼ inches with some negative ease smaller needles = 10 cm / 4 inches before you start needles please read the instructions carefully the 2 0 mm / us0 and 2 5 mm / us1½ or suitable sole gussets heel and back of the leg are to obtain gauge circular needles at least 80 worked on needle 1 for the first sock and on cm / 32 inches long needle 2 for the second sock the instep and socks can be knitted with dpns two shorter front of the leg are worked on needle 2 for circulars or a mini circular but the instructions the first sock and on needle 1 for the second have been written for magic loop sock anna m socks page 1/4 instructions toe with mc and smaller needles cast on 20 24 24 sts in total using turkish or any other toe- up cast-on method of your choice there are now 10 12 12 sts on each needle work the toe increases as follows round 1 knit round 2 on needle 1 work *k1 kfb knit until 3 sts remain kfb k2* repeat * - * on needle 2 repeat rnds 1 and 2 until there are 32 36 40 sts on each needle foot knit 2 rnds with mc attach cc1 knit 2 rnds with cc1 and 2 rnds with mc switch to larger needles if desired work mini gusset increases according to chart a as follows attaching and continue in the established stripe pattern cutting cc2 when appropriate in each round while working the gusset increases on needle work chart a sts 1-8 a total of 7 8 9 times 1 first sock or needle 2 second sock as and then work sts 9-16 once follows switch back
